page.syntax: String as C = External_record_content_get(C tablename,C content_expression[,C order[,C filter]])

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The table that contains the records you wish to retrieve.

argument.name: content_expression
argument.description: An expression that processes the records that are selected and returns a character value.

argument.name: order
argument.description: Optional. Default = "" (record number order). A character order expression that sorts selected records.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = All records. A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value. Selects records from the table.

page.description: Retrieve external tables records in a cr-lf separated list.
page.discussion: The TABLE.EXTERNAL_RECORD_CONTENT_GET() method creates a CR-LF delimited string of values from a table. The values in the string are obtained by evaluating the Content_Expn for each record in the table that satisfies the Filter_Expn. The order of the values in the string is specified by the Order_Expn. This method is very useful if you have to populate an array with values from a table. Note : When working with a table that is already open, <TBL>.RECORD_CONTENT_GET() is faster.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script populates an array with the first and last names of people in Massachusetts from the Customer table.
section.example: dim names100 as C list = table.external_record_content_GET("customer", "alltrim(firstname) + ' ' + lastname", "lastname", "state = 'ma'") names.initialize(list)

section.description: This function returns nothing because the Content_Expn (in this case the 'date' field) returns a Date type.
Here we use the dtoc() function to transform the content_expn to a character type.

In this example, its hard to see what i have done, but I have prefixed the content expression with a NULL string ( '' -- two single quotes). this makes the content_expression return a character value.
This technique of prefixing a value with a NULL string to transform it to a character value is new in V5 (i.e. could not be done in v4.5). it is very useful.
